department.en: Department of Computer Science and Elec. Engineering

goal.en: “This Semester: This course introduces fundamental concepts of Computer Science/Engineering. In addition, the class will discuss basic programming skills. Python and C++ languages will be taught. The following outline is from the main textbook. This course outline could be changed if time is not allowed to complete all lectures. Additional lectures for term projects and assignments could be added to the outline. Winter Break: You need to study a part of Java Programming Next Semester (Introduction to Computer Science II): Finishing C++ programming, Java Programming“
goal.ch: “本課程介紹計算機科學/工程學的基本概念。 此外，全班還將討論基本的編程技能。 將教導C / C ++和Java語言。 以下概述摘自主要教科書。“

content.en:
“In each week, the class will discuss fundamental CS concepts for one hour, plus programming skills for two hours. The lab experiment class (i.e., Introduction to Computer Science Lab I and II) will discuss skills to complete assignments and projects. Lectures Are Given in Chinese.
The following outline for Computer Science Fundamentals is for both Introduction to Computer Science Ⅰand II (which will be taught in the Spring semester):
1. Introduction
2. Number System
3. Data Storage
4. Operation on Data
5. Computer Organization
6. Computer Networks
7. Operating Systems
8. Algorithms
9. Programming Languages
10. Software Engineering
11. Data Structure
12. Abstract Data Type
13. File Structure
14. Databases
15. Data Compression
16. Security
17. Theory of Computation
18. Artificial Intelligent
Four Class Modules for Programming
Module I: Practice of Python Programming
Module II: Foundation of Structured Programming (C and C++)
Module III: Foundation of Object-Oriented Programming (C++ and Java)
Module IV: Window Programming and Term Project
Python Programming – 1/2 First Semester
． Ch1: Beginnings
． Ch2: Control
． Ch3: Algorithms and Program Development
． Ch4: Working with Strings
． Ch5: Functions-QuickStart
． Ch6: Files and Exceptions I
． Ch7: Lists and Tuples
． Ch8: More on Functions
C/C++ Programming – 1/2 First Semester and 1/2 Second Semester
． Chapter 2: Introduction to C++ Programming
． Chapter 3: Introduction to Classes and Objects
． Chapter 4,5: Control Statements
． Chapter 6: Functions and an Introduction to Recursion
． Chapter 7: Arrays and Vectors
． Chapter 8: Pointers
(Winter Break)
． Chapter 9, 10: Classes
． Chapter 11: Operator Overloading
． Chapter 12: Inheritance
． Chapter 15: Stream Input/Output
． Chapter 16: Exception Handling
Java Programming – 1/2 Second Semester
Part I: Fundamentals of Programming (Ch. 1 – 8)
Home Work during Winter Break
Part II: Object-Oriented Programming
． Chapter 9 Objects and Classes
． Chapter 10 Thinking in Objects
． Chapter 11 Inheritance and Polymorphism
． Chapter 12 Exception Handling and Text I/O
． Chapter 13 Abstract Classes and Interfaces
． Chapter 17 Binary I/O
Part III: GUI Programming
． Chapter 14 JavaFX Basics
． Chapter 15 Event-Driven Programming and Animations
． Chapter 16 JavaFX Controls and Multimedia
Part IV: Data Structures and Algorithms
． Optional“
1. All students need to wear mask when we have face-to-face class (for lab class).
2. 1/3 of class will be presented in English (i.e., Intro to CS lectures)
3. 2/3 of class will be presented in Chinese (i.e., programming class).
content.ch: 如果不夠時間完成所有課程，則可能更改本課程大綱。 也可能會有額外的相關學期項目和作業被附加到課程大綱中。

textbook.en: “““Foundations of Computer Science,” Third Edition, Behrouz Forouzan and Firouz Mosharraf, Thomson Introduction to Java Programming, 10E by Y. Daniel Liang“
textbook.ch: “““Foundations of Computer Science,” Third Edition, Behrouz Forouzan and Firouz Mosharraf, Thomson Introduction to Java Programming, 10E by Y. Daniel Liang“

grading.ch: “期中考15％ (in English) 期末考 15％ (in English) 程式作業 70％ (Java Homework) 出席率 (+/-％)“
